option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/projects/PhotoFactCheck":"{\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/ExifDataAdapter.kt\":\"This file contains an `ExifDataAdapter` class and several functions within it.\\n\\n`ExifDataAdapter`: A class that extends `RecyclerView.Adapter` and is responsible for displaying a list of EXIF data (metadata associated with a digital image) in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`ExifViewHolder`: A class that extends `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` and represents a single item in the RecyclerView, containing a `TextView` to display the EXIF data.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: A function that creates a new `ExifViewHolder` instance by inflating a `TextView` and setting its padding and text size.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: A function that binds the EXIF data to the `TextView` in the `ExifViewHolder` at the specified position.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: A function that returns the number of EXIF data items to be displayed in the RecyclerView.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary plugins for the Android application and Kotlin Android development.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n2. Applies the Kotlin Android plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n\\nThese plugins provide the necessary build configuration and dependencies for the Android application and Kotlin Android development, ensuring a consistent setup across all sub-projects or modules.\",\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/CameraCaptureHelper.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions that are used to capture photos using the Android Camera API and add a watermark with location and timestamp information to the captured images.\\n\\n`CameraCaptureHelper`: A class that provides functionality for capturing photos and adding watermarks to the captured images.\\n\\n`getLocation()`: A function that retrieves the last known location from the device\\u0027s location services.\\n`addWatermarkToBitmap(src: Bitmap, text: String)`: A function that adds a watermark with the provided text to the given Bitmap.\\n`getUserFormat()`: A function that retrieves the user\\u0027s preferred coordinate format from the app\\u0027s settings.\\n`takePicture(imageCapture: ImageCapture, onComplete: (File?) -\\u003e Unit)`: A function that captures a photo, adds a watermark with location and timestamp information, and saves the resulting image to a file.\",\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/GeoFormatConverter.kt\":\"This file contains a utility object called `GeoFormatConverter` that provides functions to format a `Location` object in different geographic coordinate formats.\\n\\n`GeoFormatConverter`: A utility object that provides functions to format a `Location` object in different geographic coordinate formats.\\n\\n`formatLocation`: Formats a `Location` object in either decimal or degrees-minutes-seconds (DMS) format.\\n\\n`toDMS`: Converts a geographic coordinate (latitude or longitude) to a string in the degrees-minutes-seconds (DMS) format.\",\"/app/src/test/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. The file does not define any classes or functions, but rather contains a single unit test that checks if the addition operation `2 + 2` is correct.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test case to verify the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition operation `2 + 2` returns the expected result of `4`.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android application plugin, Kotlin support, and various dependencies. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build settings and dependencies for the Android application.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android application. It does not define any classes or functions, but rather tests the application\\u0027s context to ensure that the package name is correct.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\nThe `ExampleInstrumentedTest` class is an instrumented test that runs on an Android device. The `useAppContext()` function checks that the application\\u0027s package name is correct.\",\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `MainActivity` class, which is the main entry point of the Android application.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the application, which provides the user interface for launching the camera and settings activities.\\n\\n`onCreate`: The function that is called when the activity is created, where the user interface is set up and the click listeners for the camera and settings buttons are defined.\",\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/SettingsActivity.kt\":\"`SettingsActivity`: This class represents the settings activity of the application, allowing users to access and modify application settings.\\n\\n`onCreate`: This function is called when the settings activity is created, and it sets up the layout and the settings fragment.\\n\\n`SettingsFragment`: This class represents the settings fragment, which displays the application\\u0027s settings and allows the user to modify them.\\n\\n`onCreatePreferences`: This function is called when the settings fragment is created, and it sets the preferences from the `root_preferences.xml` file.\",\"/app/src/main/java/ru/mokolomyagi/photofactcheck/CameraActivity.kt\":\"This file contains an Android application that allows users to take photos and view them in full-screen mode. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`CameraActivity`: An activity that provides a camera interface, allowing users to take photos and view them.\\n\\n`requestPermissionsIfNeeded()`: Checks if the necessary permissions (camera and location) are granted, and requests them if not.\\n\\n`startCamera()`: Initializes the camera preview and sets up the image capture functionality.\\n\\n`setupCaptureButton()`: Sets up the click listener for the capture button, which triggers the image capture process.\\n\\n`showFullScreenImage()`: Displays the captured image in a full-screen dialog.\\n\\n`createLayout()`: Constructs the layout for the camera activity, including the preview view, capture button, and image view.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project named \\\"PhotoFactCheck\\\". It sets up the plugin management and dependency resolution for the project, and defines the root project name and the included modules.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories for plugin management, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories for dependency resolution, including Google and Maven Central, and sets the repositories mode to fail on project repositories.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Defines the name of the root project as \\\"PhotoFactCheck\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\"}"}
